"Division by zero is defined and results in a meaningful value"

The statement is false because in mathematics, division by zero is considered undefined because it leads to various contradictions and inconsistencies. When we divide a number by a very small positive number, the result becomes extremely large. As the divisor approaches zero, the quotient tends to infinity, which is not a finite and well-defined value. On the other hand, if the divisor approaches zero from the negative side, the quotient tends to negative infinity.

"The square root of a negative number is a real number."

The statement is false because the square root of a negative number is not a real number. In the real number system, there is no real number that, when squared, gives a negative result. This is because the square of any real number is always non-negative.
